name: Black Web 2
description:
PLEASE NOTE: This is an update to the "Black Web" style.
Banish white backgrounds!
This simple style inverts the brightness on most web pages through Google Chrome browser
Turns black on white to white on black, but unlike Google's High Contrast extension, this keeps other colour shades more compatible with the originals. For example, links that were dark blue on white become light blue on black.
Try it and save your eyesight!
additional_info:
"Black Web" style stopped working properly in September 2015, but I can no longer access my old account to update it, so I created this as a replacement. Updates might follow shortly.
UPDATE: Thanks to Admin Jason I've regained access to my old account and fixed the "Black Web" style, so this style is now just a copy of that.
UPDATE: 2 Jun 2020: Updates to fix issues on latest Chrome versions.
css:
/* i really want this to be global */
html, iframe, frame {background-color: white; -webkit-filter: invert(1)
hue-rotate(180deg) !important}
  
div[aria-label="YouTube Video Player in Fullscreen"],
div[aria-label="YouTube Video Player in Fullscreen"] div.ytp-tooltip.ytp-bottom.ytp-preview,
img,
video,
embed[flashvars],
div[style*=".jpg"],
span[style*=".jpg"],
div[style*=".jpeg"],
span[style*=".jpeg"],
*[type*="application/x-shockwave-flash"],
*[type*="application/x-silverlight"],
div[class*="html5-video-player unstarted-mode"]    
{-webkit-filter: hue-rotate(-180deg) invert(1) !important}


div[aria-label="YouTube Video Player in Fullscreen"] video
{-webkit-filter: none !important}
